page.title: 17CHURCH,HALL,AND PARK
page.content: The fact that the Domesday Book records the presence of a priest suggests that a church already existed in Hagley by 1086.Restoration work in 1984 revealed a curious carved stone that has since been identified as of {Norman origin.}This matches seven {beakheads}of a similar period found last century in the south porch. A Norman church probably stood on the site until the late 13th.century possibly replacing an earlier Saxon building.The reign of Henry III saw the church rebuilt and enlarged in local stone. In{1754},Sir George Lyttelton had the Chancel pulled down and{rebuilt}on the designs of Sanderson Miller,and further changes were made in 1809.
